intro: Pouzolzia sanguinea var. sanguinea, commonly known as red pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with greenish-white flowers that appear in late summer. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
